    • Constructor Detail

      • DualMGDrivetrain

        public DualMGDrivetrain(MotorGroup left,
                        MotorGroup right)
        The method to initialize dualMGDrivetrain
        Parameters:
        left - Makes a MotorGroup equal to the input to be used later by DualMGDrivetrain
        right - Makes a MotorGroup equal to the input to be used later by DualMGDrivetrain

    • Method Detail

      • getGearsAmount

        public int getGearsAmount()
        This returns the maximum amount of gears that both of the motorGroups have.
        Returns:
        an int representing above

      • setGears

        public void setGears(int gear)
        This sets the gears to the input and if you input a gear that is greater than the amount of gears we have than it will set it to the max gear. Oh yeah by the way I have the total amount of gears currently set to four and we might need to change that.
        Parameters:
        gear - the gear to change to

      • getGears

        public int getGears()
        This returns the current gear for the left motor. The right gear will be the same as the left gear.
        Returns:
        gear the gear of the left motor

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        The right motor will also be enabled if the left one is.
        Returns:
        whether or not the left motor is enabled

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Disables or enables both motors.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Whether or not to enable the motors

      • setValues

        public void setValues(float leftValue,
                      float rightValue)
        Sets the speed of the motors. This could work for tank drive but it is recommended to use updateTank.
        Parameters:
        leftValue - the value to set to the left motorGroup
        rightValue - the value to set to the right motorGroup

      • getSetValue

        public float[] getSetValue()
        This returns the speed of the two motors.
        Returns:
        it is an array with the first value being the left motorGroup value and the second value being the right motorGroup value

      • updateTank

        public void updateTank(double leftSpeed,
                       double rightSpeed,
                       double scaleFactor)
        This is used for tank drive. Tank drive is useful for testing but not much else.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - the speed for the right motor
        rightSpeed - the speed for the right motor
        scaleFactor - Scales the output by this number, use 1 for default

      • updateArcade

        public void updateArcade(double forwardInput,
                         double horizontalInput,
                         double scaleFactor)
        This is used for the robot to be controlled for arcade drive. This can also be used for west coast because they are programmatically the same but the inputs are different.
        Parameters:
        forwardInput - forward speed
        horiszontalInput - horizontal speed
        scaleFactor - Scales the output by this number, use 1 for default

      • calculateArcade

        public static float[] calculateArcade(double forwardInput,
                                      double horizontalInput,
                                      double scaleFactor)
        Calculates the math behind updateArcade. The advantage of doing the math outside of the original method is to be able to use JUnit test in order to check the math
        Parameters:
        forwardInput - the power that you want it to go forward
        horizontalInput - the power you want it to turn
        scaleFactor - the power the inputs are set to
        Returns:
        the speed for the wheels to go

      • updateBrakingDrive

        public void updateBrakingDrive(double forwardInput,
                               double horizontalInput,
                               double scaleFactor,
                               double maxValue)
        sets the speed of the wheels to what calculateBrakingDriveReturns returns This makes the robot move slower based on the maxValue input.
        Parameters:
        forwardInput - the power that you want it to go forward
        horizontalInput - the power you want it to turn
        scaleFactor - the power the inputs are set to
        maxValue - the maxSpeed the wheels to go

      • calculateBrakingDrive

        public static float[] calculateBrakingDrive(double forwardInput,
                                            double horizontalInput,
                                            double scaleFactor,
                                            double maxValue)
        Calculates the math behind braking drive
        Parameters:
        forwardInput - the power that you want it to go forward
        horizontalInput - the power you want it to turn
        scaleFactor - the power the inputs are set to
        maxValue - the maxSpeed the wheels to go
        Returns:
        speed the speed of the wheels

      • updateReverseBrakingDrive

        public void updateReverseBrakingDrive(double forwardInput,
                                      double horizontalInput,
                                      double scaleFactor,
                                      double breakInput)
        This is arcade drive but the inputs are divided by breakinput. And if breakinput is the only input it goes backwards. This is meant for when the forward input can't be negative, like for triggers.
        Parameters:
        forwardInput - The forward power
        horizontalInput - The horizontal power
        scaleFactor - the scalefactor
        breakInput - the reverse power or amount the other inputs will be divided by

      • spinToAngle

        public void spinToAngle(double newAngle,
                        boolean relativePositioning)
        This spins the robot to a new angle based on time. This is not that accurate but works.
        Parameters:
        newAngle - This is the angle that you want the robot to move to
        relativePositioning - this says whether or not you want the robot to rotate to newAngle or to rotate the newAngle input degrees

      • disableMotors

        public void disableMotors()
        Sets both the motor speeds to zero

      • turn

        public void turn(boolean rightTurn)
        Makes the robot turn at a quarter speed
        Parameters:
        rightTurn - whether or not turn right

      • moveStraight

        public void moveStraight(float speed,
                         float leftRate,
                         float rightRate)
        Makes the robot move straight
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed at which the robot moves
        leftRate - how fast the encoders say the left wheels of the robot is moving
        rightRate - how fast the encoders say the right wheels of the robot is moving
